title.narrative: "Rehabilitation of critical WASH services and Shelter in Kallaseh neighborhood using a municipality led area based approach"

description.narrative:
UN Habitat plans a multi-sector area based rehabilitation of basic housing and WASH services to support the return of IDPs to the Kallaseh neighborhood. Specifically, the Project will: Restore the solid waste disposal and management in Kallaseh by: o Provide the Aleppo municipality with disinfection and sterilizing materials o Provide 600 hygiene kits to 3000 persons and conduct 5 hygiene awareness campaigns for returnees: o Provision of fees and trainings to 100 laborers to the Hygiene Department of the Aleppo Municipality for solid waste management Rehabilitation of water and sewage infrastructures servicing Kallaseh by: o Repair of 1,500 house connections to reconnect about 185 buildings to the water main network. o Minor repair of the main water network including replacement of damaged pipes and fittings as necessary to restore minimum functionality. Rehabilitation of 150 damaged housing units in Kallaseh by: o Support Aleppo cadastral department to facilitate the returns of IDPs to Kallaseh – in particular the most vulnerable IDPs (funded through another UN Habitat project) o Support the Syndicate of Engineers to conduct field damage assessments to address structural integrity of targeted buildings. o Rehabilitation of residential buildings’ common spaces and infrastructures to ensure minimum safety and structural integrity standards are met and to facilitate access by children, elderly, and persons with special needs. o Rehabilitation of 150 housing units to meet basic humanitarian standards.
The Project will work with the Aleppo Municipality and Syndicate of Engineers to deliver planned activities. To the maximum extent possible, supplies will be procured through distributors in Aleppo, labourers will be recruited from the targeted area, and skilled expertise from Aleppo residents will be prioritized.
For Aleppo NGO will lead the community mobilization and engagement activities including the hygiene campaigns, monitoring of beneficiaries for hygiene kits and shelter rehabilitation, and to facilitate the participation of women and vulnerable groups.
This Project builds upon other UN Habitat interventions planned in February 2017 in the targeted areas – clearing of debris, repair of critical infrastructure, support to municipality services and support to cadastral services.
